That's great that you're excited to try bouldering, John! When it comes to being a first-timer, I would say the most important thing is to have fun and be patient with yourself. There's definitely a learning curve, but it's all part of the experience. And don't worry too much about making mistakes - we all do, and it's all just a part of the journey! As for tips, here are a few that have helped me:

1. Start with a warm-up: This could be something as simple as jogging in place, jumping jacks, or some light stretching. It helps get your blood flowing and your muscles ready for activity.
2. Focus on good form: Proper technique is crucial in bouldering, and it will help you avoid injuries. Keep your arms straight, engage your core, and use your legs as much as possible.
3. Use a crash pad: A crash pad provides an extra layer of protection and cushioning when you fall, which is an inevitable part of bouldering. It can also help boost your confidence in trying new moves.

I'm excited for you to give bouldering a try! And remember, we're doing some hikes together this weekend, so I'm looking forward to that too! Have you watched any other climbing or adventure-themed movies lately? I'd love to hear your recommendations!

That's awesome, John! I'd recommend starting with some lower-grade problems and focusing on your footwork, that's what helped me lot when I first started. Bouldering is a lot about technique and control rather than brute strength. Also, don't forget to warm up and stretch before you climb, it really helps prevent injuries. And most importantly, have fun!
